DOC.brief_summary: This study aim determine factor related change diabetes-related distress change depressive symptom three year follow-up Asian adult type 2 diabetes mellitus primary care . The investigator explore impact patient demographic , cardiometabolic control , medication adherence , health-related quality life , self-efficacy self-management behavior diabetes-related distress depressive symptom .
DOC.brief_title: Emotional Disorders Outcomes Adults With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus Primary Care
DOC.detailed_description: Patients type 2 diabetes mellitus ( T2DM ) show experience psychological burden distort illness perception . These psychological burden include feel burned-out , fatigue , distress depression , addition distort illness perception often lead difficulty cop demand life-style change adherence medication . Diabetes-related distress ( DRD ) depressive symptom ( DS ) associate glycaemic control medication adherence , life-styles behavior , respectively . However , evidence relationship DRD , DS clinically significant outcome scarce Asian adult T2DM . Primary care patient participate re-invited . This repeat cross-sectional study cohort 700 patient first studied 2013 ( Emotional Distress adult type 2 Diabetes Mellitus & Quality Life [ EDDMQoL ] study National Medical Research Register ( NMRR ) identification number : NMRR-12-1167-14158 ) . Demographic data ( age , gender , ethnicity , religion , educational level , occupation monthly income ) , smoke status , self-perceive social support health literacy collect questionnaire .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Those participated EDDMQoL study 2 . Adults age least 30 yearold 3 . Diagnosed T2DM three year ago 4 . On regular followup least three visit previous year 1 . Patients pregnant lactate 2 . Having psychiatric/psychological disorder could impair judgment memory 3 . Patients read understand English , Malay Mandarin
